{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3130868,"name":"Simon ","username":"happyboy11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/e274bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T22:56:14.415Z","cooked":"

I am struggling with what I think is a sticky fault, and I dont know how to fix it. The PDP has orange slow flashing lights, and I have no robot communication in the driver station. Any advice?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T22:56:51.938Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":315.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424079,"topic_slug":"sticky-fault","display_username":"Simon ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56570,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sticky-fault/424079/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3130899,"name":"Carolyn","username":"caro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/b19c9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T23:31:31.599Z","cooked":"

Hello! The “sticky fault” happens when the voltage drops below a certain level, I think its 6v. To clear it you’ll connect to the PDP via the Phoenix Tuner and blink the PDP.
I haven’t seen a sticky fault cause comms to fail so it may be an unrelated issue, have you cycled power?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T23:31:31.599Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":424079,"topic_slug":"sticky-fault","display_username":"Carolyn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50407,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sticky-fault/424079/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131002,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T01:38:59.098Z","cooked":"

Other than supplying power to the rio and radio, the PDP is not along the data/comms pathway between the DS application and your robot code, so the ONLY way that could be related is if the rio or radio lacked power (and I’d hope that would be obvious enough to notice).

@caro already answered how to clear the sticky fault (I think you actually have to blink it twice in quick succession). So focusing on the comms issue, we’ll need a bit more information.

  1. How are you connected? Wifi through radio? Ethernet through radio? Ethernet direct to rio? Or usb direct to rio?
  2. Has it ever worked with this laptop/rio combination? If not, have you tried any other laptops?
  3. Do you have the team number set correctly in the DS? What about on the rio?
  4. Is it constant red or does it turn green then go back to red? Solid red or 50/50 red/green?
  5. Have you recently deployed code to it? Its possible the code is crashing. Check riolog.
  6. Confirm you dont have multiple laptops connected with the DS application running. Only one DS can connect to the robot at a time and the other will see a red comms light.
  7. What are the LEDs on the rio doing? Does anything change when you connect/disconnect the laptop?

UPDATE: It was not a sticky fault. I was having issues with my driver station version.
